strategy: Use LightGBM with the following settings: num_boost_round=700, learning_rate=0.05, max_depth=10. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median, drop columns with more than 50% missing values, and cast object columns to 'category' dtype to enable LightGBM's native handling of categorical features.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Convert all object dtype columns to 'category' for LightGBM
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype('category')
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype('category')

# Define LightGBM model with improved hyperparameters
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=700,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=10,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
X_train = X_train.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)
X_test = X_test.drop(columns_to_drop, axis=1)

# Convert all object dtype columns to 'category' for LightGBM
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype('category')
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype('category')

# Define LightGBM model with improved hyperparameters but reduced max_depth to prevent timeout
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=300,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=8,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
